intro: Griffitharia wardii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes vines and climbing plants. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing a single seed. Griffitharia wardii is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
